required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Senstivity and Specificity of Using Salivary miRNAs in Detection of Malignant Transformation of Oral Lesions.
clinical_study.official_title: The Senstivity and Specificity of Using Salivary Extracellular Vesicles as Non -Invasive Source of miRNAs (412,512) in Detection of Malignant Transformation of Potientially Malignant Oral Lesions.

brief_summary.textblock: Due to cancer is a leading cause of death world wide , we will coduct the study to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of using salivary miRNAs (412,512) from the salivary extracellular vesicles (index test) in detection of the malignant transformation of the premalignant lesions using the qualitative real time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) analysis in comparison to taking biopsy .

detailed_description.textblock: our study is a case control study,we will coduct our study to evaluate specificity and sensitivity of using salivary extracellular vesicles miRNAs (412,512) in detection of malignant transformation in potientially malignant oral lesions by using qRT-PCR analysis ,participants will be selected and arranged in 3 groups the control group, potentially malignant group and malignant group ,the salivary samples from the participants will be collected and then microRNA extraction steps will be done through the laboratory steps ,that include extracellular vesicles isolation, PCR Analysis for miRNA-412 and miRNA-512 expression ,also the histopathologic diagnosis and examination of all specimens were confirmed by pathologist.

primary_outcome.measure: the sensitivity and specificity of salivary miRNAs (412,512) to detect the malignant transformation of oral potentially malignant lesions
primary_outcome.description: measuring the sensitivity and specificity of using the salivary miRNAs(412,512)to detect the malignant transformation in potentially malignant lesions

arm_group.description: participants with out any systemic medical problemes or oral lesions. we will only take saliva sample.
participants with suspicious oral lesions without any medical diseases. we will take saliva sample and take a biopsy sample .
participants with already diagnosed oral malignant lesions without receiving any treatment yett

intervention.description: quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction to detect the salivary miRNAs 412,512) to indicate the malignant transformation in potientially malignant oral lesions.
intervention.other_name: biopsy sample for potientially maliganat and malignant group

study_pop.textblock:
- Group of normal control subjects: 18 Healthy subjects presenting no clinically detectable oral lesions matched for age, gender, and risk factors .Group of subjects with potentially malignant lesions: 18 patient with innocuous lesions.
- Group of subjects with malignant lesions:18 patient with suspicious lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinically evident lesions as morphologically altered tissue noted at conventional visual tactile examination
- Clinically evident suspicious lesions which are morphologically altered tissue noted at comprehensive visual ductile examination ( CVTE) with a definitive diagnosis of a potentially malignant disorders (PMD) or even a malignant disorder to be a distinct possibly.
- Healthy subjects presenting no clinically detectable oral lesions matched for age, gender, and risk factors will recruited as controls.
Exclusion Criteria:
.<18 years of age.
- pregnant or breast feeding. .psychiatrically or mentally unstable.
